snippet: Mangoes are objects of envy, love, rivalry as well as a new status symbol for India’s new rich.
abstract: Memo from India; India produces about 15 million tons of mangoes annually, roughly 40 percent of global production; according to the Central Institute of Subtropical Horticulture, between 40 and 60 varieties are sold commercially; mango exporters do a thriving trade with several Persian Gulf countries, where more than six million Indians are working, and some domestic mango eaters suspect the best mangoes are shipped out of India for higher prices abroad.

byline.contributor: Sruthi Gottipati contributed reporting from Mumbai.

lead_paragraph: Mangoes are objects of envy, love, rivalry as well as a new status symbol for India’s new rich.
